prs.title: feat: updates AggregateProposal to remove dependecy on legacy proposals
prs.truncated_body:
This commit updates the `AggregateProposal` function to remove the functionality to aggregate legacy proposals. The function now only aggregates new mcms lib proposals.

This change also requires changes to a Changeset to replace the creation of legacy proposals with the new mcms lib proposals.

commits.message:
feat: updates AggregateProposal to remove dependecy on legacy proposals

This commit updates the `AggregateProposal` function to remove the
functionality to aggregate legacy proposals. The function now only
aggregates new mcms lib proposals.

This change also requires changes to a Changeset to replace the creation
of legacy proposals with the new mcms lib proposals.

We already have `getRate` which returns token price based on `JsonRpcProvider` and contract address.

prs.title: Fix view-function-multi-chain test
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

The `view-function-multi-chain` EA has tests which both fail to pass and fail to compile.
The test failure is because it expects an error from `ethers` but the error includes the version of the `ethers` library so whenever the `ethers` dependency is updated, this expectation will fail.

## Changes

1. Instead of using `toMatchSnapshot` to match the exact error, expect an err

prs.title: Fix test compilation workflow
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

We have a workflow which checks if tests in changed adapters compile without errors.
There is a pattern with a list of adapter that are known to fail compilation.
We use `grep` to filter the list of changed adapters to get only the ones that are not expected to fail.

prs.title: op-devstack: fix orchestrator option system hooks
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Previously `SystemHook` was attached to `Finally` stage of orchestrator options, to make whatever final stage aware of it, to run the hooks. But that doesn't work properly, since we want to couple it to the test-scope.

Instead, we now split it out, and pass it to the orchestrator constructor, to run these hooks eventually, when the test-scope system is created.

Also includ

commits.message: op-devstack: fix orchestrator option system hooks

prs.title: supervisor: Trigger Indexing on Local Safe Update
prs.truncated_body:
If ever the Managed Node is only receiving L2 blocks via Derivation (like if the P2P is broken, or if the Sequencing Window has Lapsed), the Supervisor still needs to be prompted to index all log events.

This trigger will happen in response to the L1:L2 link being recorded in the Derivation database, and will happen prior to Cross Safe updating.

commits.message: supervisor: Trigger Indexing on Local Safe Update

We considered forking and extending [`tx-fuzz`](https://github.com/MariusVanDerWijden/tx-fuzz) to support interop messages, but decided the `devnet-sdk`+NAT is easier and more aligned with the long-term testing strategy. Some non-interop prior work that included `tx-fuzz` in NATs is summarized [here](https://discord.com/channe

prs.title: consensus/bor: remove state root calculation from bor consensus
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

We call the `IntermediateRoot` function in `Finalize` method of consensus while validating a remote block. We update the `header.Root` to the result of the call which is useless as we're only operating on a copy of header. Moreover, we're not supposed to update the state root while validating a block. We only need to compare our local state root with the one present in header.

prs.title: chore: increase the F3 GMessage buffer size to 1024
prs.truncated_body:
The GMessage buffer size is a non-consensus breaking parameter. It's a headroom beyond which pubsub will start dropping messages before they are seen by the F3 message processing logic.

During passive testing of F3 on mainnet we increased this buffer from its default value of 128 twice. We still observe reports by SPs that indicate the increased value may still not be enough for all cases. Incr

commits.message:
Increase the F3 GMessage buffer size to 1024

The GMessage buffer size is a non-consensus breaking parameter. It's a
headroom beyond which pubsub will start dropping messages before they
are seen by the F3 message processing logic.

During passive testing of F3 on mainnet we increased this buffer from
its default value of 128 twice. We still observe reports by SPs that
indicate the increased value may still not be enough for all cases.
Increasing the buffer size is a low-risk parameter to adjust since the
increase in memory consumption is negligible.

The root cause of the need for larger buffer size is slow state read in
Lotus which consequently slows the serialised flow of message processing
in F3. Work is under way to improve the efficiency of Lotus state fetch
call that should reduce the reliance on larger buffers. But considering
the small cost of having slightly larger buffers, it's worthwhile to do

prs.title: Native: unify hardfork enabling checks across native contracts
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

We have `ApplicationEngine.IsHardforkEnabled` method that should be used across all native contracts to check if hardfork is enabled. This change is compatible with the public networks and won't cause forks for the current node implementation, so it's just a code style unification for now. However, *it's important to keep the same style in future development* because it may cause

commits.message:
Native: unify hardfork enabling checks across native contracts

We have ApplicationEngine.IsHardforkEnabled method that should be used
across all native contracts to check if hardfork is enabled. This change
is compatible with the public networks and won't cause forks (even
potentially), so it's just a code style unification.
